results.title: Whistle down the wind
results.creator_credit: Bryan Forbes, Richard Attenborough and Beaver Films
results.brief_description: Based on Mary Hayley Bell’s popular novel, this is a charming and thoughtful study of the fragile nature of childhood trusts and beliefs. Hayley Mills and Alan Bates give excellent performances in this story of three innocent children who find a fugitive from the law in their barn and believe that he is Jesus. Produced by award-winning Richard Attenborough, this film is a poignant unveiling of the children’s gradual understanding of the truth, which will delight adults and children alike.

results.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the best western films ever made, director John Sturges explores the relationship between two of the west’s most celebrated legends - Wyatt Earp (Burt Lancaster) and Doc Holliday (Kirk Douglas). Earp is a U.S. Marshal in Dodge City and Holliday a dentist - turned gambler - who knows how to handle a gun. When Earp saves Holliday from mob violence, the foes become friends and join forces to rid the west of the lawless Clanton gang. It all leads up to the legendary Gunfight at the O.K. Corral. Screenplay by Leon Uris. Featuring a small appearance by a very young Dennis Hopper.

results.title: Map of the human heart (D)
results.creator_credit: Vincent Ward, Tim Bevan and Vincent Ward Films
results.brief_description: New Zealander Vincent Ward’s third film is an immensely ambitious and audacious love story spanning 30 years and two continents. Much of it is set and filmed above the Arctic Circle in northern Canada, providing breathtaking scenery. Some journeys have no map to guide them. This is an epic voyage from a kingdom of ice to a world on fire. It is the magical story of Avik and Albertine and a love that survived decades, impossible distances and the ravages of war.

results.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
results.creator_credit: James Foley, Stanley R Zupnik, Jerry Tokofsky and Zupnik Enterprises
results.brief_description: In response to poor sales figures, a consulting salesman offers an incentive to a group of Chicago real-estate salesmen. The agent with the most sales at the end of the month wins a Cadillac, second prize is a set of steak knives, third prize is the sack!! Now more than ever the pressure is on to perform and the salesmen are desperate to do anything to hold on to their jobs… even robbery, extortion and embezzlement. David Mamet’s moving screenplay (based on his play) focuses on the dilemmas of the various salesmen desperate to keep their jobs who sustain themselves by reliving past glories. Stars an ensemble of fine actors including Al Pacino, Jack Lemmon, Alec Baldwin, Ed Harris and Alan Arkin.

results.title: The Mambo kings
results.creator_credit: Arne Glimcher, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises, La Studia Canal and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: It is the early fifties and with a suitcase full of songs and hearts full of passion, two brothers leave Cuba and come to America in search of their Dream. They start a band and play the Mambo, Samba and Cha-cha in a nightclub every night. This is the story of their quest for show business fame based on the Pulitzer Prize winning “The Mambo Kings play Songs of Love” by Oscar Hjuelos. This film abounds with exciting Latin American music and fascinating footage of the “I Love Lucy” show is matched with footage of the brothers when their big break arrives. Stars Armand Assante and Antonio Banderas.

results.title: The Stolen children = Il Ladro di bambini
results.creator_credit: Gianni Amelio, Angelo Rizzoli, Raidue, Alia Film and Erre Produzioni
results.brief_description: Two children, Rosetta and Giusseppe are victims of a child prostitution ring. After their mother is arrested, they are taken by Antonio the Carabiniere from the North to the South of Italy, looking for an orphanage that will take the children. The children have learned to trust no-one, not even each other, yet this journey with Antonio begins to break down the barriers that the children have always had to maintain. This very special, rewarding film was the winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1992 Cannes Film Festival and has been universally hailed as one of the finest Italian films released in many years. Stars Enrico Lo Verso, Valentina Scalici and Giuseppe Ieracitano.

results.title: Hullabaloo over Georgie & Bonnie's pictures
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant, London Weekend Television and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: The “hullaballo” in question is a leisurely, but fiercely determined race for possession of a priceless collection of rare Indian pictures. It’s enlivened by a romp through royal India…a world of princes, palaces, tourists, precious art objects and their wheelers and dealers… but more than this, the film gives us rare insight into the lasting values of life. The films boasts a wonderful screenplay by Ruth Prawer Jhabuala. Stars Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: Green Card
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Jean Gontier and Greencard Productions
results.brief_description: Directed by internationally acclaimed Peter Weir, this charming comedy is based on a very real issue facing many foreigners in the United States today - the possibility of marrying an American citizen in order to obtain a “greencard” which allows them to live and work in America. Starring the big, lovable Depardieu, in his english-speaking film debut, as a French alien who wants to remain in the US, and MacDowell as a New York horticulturalist who desperately wants to rent an apartment with a greenhouse (the owners of which only want to rent to married couples). Through a mutual friend they meet and strike a deal - they’ll get married so that each can have what they desire. They marry in a quick legal ceremony and then part company, only to find they must get to know one another and act as husband and wife when immigration officials begins snooping around.

results.title: Gardens of stone
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Michael I. Levy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: There’s the war-toughened sergeant who passionately longs to train soldiers for fighting in Vietnam, but is assigned to the elite Old Guard. His beautiful girlfriend, a Washington Post reporter who is fervently against the war. The zealous soldier that the sergeant takes under his wing, and the young woman who learns the pain of being an army wife. Their stories are poignantly told in Francis Coppola’s perceptive and moving film that stars James Caan, Angelica Huston, James Earl Jones and Mary Stuart Masterson. This film takes a different look at the Vietnam war era in the United States. It is a drama that captures the anguishing effect of the war on the relationships of the men and women at home. Based on the novel by Nicholas Proffitt. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: Letter to Brezhnev
results.creator_credit: Chris Bernard, Janet Goddard and Channel Four Films
results.brief_description: A movie about the craziest, most lovable teenagers to come out of Liverpool since the Beatles. It’s a fairytale full of edgy cynical realism. It’s a love story and an adventure with a rock ‘n’ roll soundtrack. It’s a movie about inner-city decay, the frustration of unemployment and people desperate for change - any change. This film has gathered an impressive array of awards and critical praise but its most impressive achievement is evident by its popularity amongst audiences. Starring Peter Firth and features music from Bronski Beat.
